com.plexus.sam.gui.config
Class ConfigurationWidget

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JPanel
                  com.plexus.sam.gui.config.ConfigurationWidget
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible
public abstract class ConfigurationWidget
extends javax.swing.JPanel

Common base class for all types of Configuration Widgets (text, choice, integer,...). One widget controls one configuration item.
All subclasses must be fully compliant javabeans see XMLEncoder.

To write a concrete ConfigurationWidget

  • Add the descriptionLabel to the panel (with wathever Layout you choose)
  • Add widgets that control the value (a JTextField, a JComboBox, ...)
  • Implement the necessary Interfaces to listen to your widgets for changes
  • Call setValue(String) when the value changes
  • Override setValue(String), start with super.setValue(value); and add code to update your widgets when it is called from outside our scope
  • Add javabean accessors/mutators to enable the widget to become fully persistent (if necessary)
setValue(String) will immediatly update the configuration.

Author:
plexus
See Also:
ConfigurationPanel, ConfigGroupPanel, Configuration, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

ConfigurationWidget

public ConfigurationWidget(java.lang.String group,
                           java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String descriptionKey,
                           java.util.ResourceBundle i18n)
Initialize the 'group' and 'key' properties referring to a value in a ConfigGroup. This invokes the abstract method setValue(String) which should initialize the widget to display the currently set value.
The description key is used to look up the description of the configuration property in the given ResourceBundle.

Parameters:
group - name of the configuration group
key - key of the value to read and write from and to the configuration
descriptionKey - key to look up the description in of the managed value in a ResourceBundle
i18n - the resourcebundle to look up the description

ConfigurationWidget

public ConfigurationWidget(java.lang.String group,
                           java.lang.String key,
                           java.lang.String descriptionKey)
Initialize the 'group' and 'key' properties referring to a value in a ConfigGroup. This invokes the abstract method setValue(String) which should initialize the widget to display the currently set value.
The description key is used to look up the description of the configuration property in the default ResourceBundle (Normally com.plexus.sam.i18n.gui, see also setDefaultI18n(ResourceBundle).

Parameters:
group - name of the configuration group
key - key of the value to read and write from and to the configuration
descriptionKey - key to look up the description in of the managed value in a ResourceBundle

loadDescription

private void loadDescription()
Load the description from the i18n ResourceBundle

setDefaultI18n

public static void setDefaultI18n(java.util.ResourceBundle i18n)
Set the default resourcebundle for looking up i18n strings. This property is read when no ResourceBundle is given at construction time.
Initially the ResourceBundle com.plexus.sam.i18n.gui is used.

Parameters:
i18n - The default ResourceBundle to look up the description

setValue

public void setValue(java.lang.String value)
Update the configuration and set the value currently visible in the widget

Parameters:
value - configuration value
